description_for_human: Verifiable AI skill safety classification with zero-knowledge ML proofs
description_for_model: Classify AI agent skills as SAFE/CAUTION/DANGEROUS with mandatory cryptographic zkML proof. Every classification includes a zero-knowledge proof that the neural network produced the result. The model (3-layer MLP, 4,419 params) extracts 35 security features from each skill and classifies using fixed-point integer arithmetic inside a ZK circuit. v2.0: trained on 425 LLM-labeled real OpenClaw skills (68% accuracy, 0.80 DANGEROUS F1). v3.0 pipeline: scaling to 1,400+ labeled skills with boundary-aware labeling, stratified sampling, and held-out evaluation. To classify by name: POST /api/v1/evaluate with {"skill": "slug-name"}. To classify with full data: POST /api/v1/evaluate with {"skill": {"name": "...", "version": "1.0.0", "author": "...", "skill_md": "...", "scripts": [], "files": []}}. Look up cached results instantly via GET /api/v1/catalog/{skill_name} (free, no auth). Costs $0.001 USDC via x402 on Base. Verify proofs free: POST /api/v1/verify with {"proof_b64": "...", "program_io": {...}}. Every response includes a model_version field. LLM-readable docs at /.well-known/llms.txt.
